page.title: 03LAW AND ORDER IN WINTERTON
page.content: Law and order in Winterton is looked after by 2 policemen who live in the village. Sometimes men from Barton come in when the Winterton men are off duty or if there is too much to do. An ordinary day's work may include things such as investigating a burglary, stopping drunk drivers, or any jobs asked for by other forces. Minor arrests for offences such as non payment of fines have to be made. There is not much crime in Winterton. Our school has been burgled though. 6 bikes have been stolen this year though some have been returned and a few burglaries have been committed. There is little vandalism except for a few people spraying paint or writing on walls. Traffic problems caused a policeman to see about a speed limit on a country road not far from the village.
